page.title: 11Schools in East Leicester.
page.content: {Linden County Primary School:}This was built in 1953 as Junior & Infant Schools until their amalgamation in 1981 caused by falling rolls. There are 451 pupils,17 teachers & 24 ancillary staff. About 58% of the children come from ethnic minority groups with mother tongue languages which include Punjabi,Urdu & Greek. {Secondary Schools:}There are 6 secondary schools in the East Leicester block,e.g. Judgemeadow Community College is for children aged 11-16 with a variety of courses for adults as well. St.Paul's is a Roman Catholic school for 11-18 year olds. Because of falling rolls,Spencefield School (11-16) & the City of Leicester School (11-18) are being amalgamated from August 1985.Issues to cause concern are: pupils' behaviour,wearing school uniform & a new exam system.
